snippet.title: World Rains wreak havoc in South Africa, Mozambique
snippet.description:
* Torrential rains across South Africas Northern and Mpumalanga provinces left a trail of death and destruction, as rivers broke their banks and swept away bridges and roads.
http://www.cnn.com/2000/WORLD/africa/02/08/s.africa.floods/index.html

snippet.title: 10 of the world's longest bridges
snippet.description:
* If you ever find yourself in Hunan, China, rent a car and drive the Jishou-Chadong Expressway: 18 tunnels under the Wuling mountains that culminate at the Aizhai Bridge, a gut-churning 1,150-foot-high suspension bridge over the Dehang Canyon. It's a man-made wonder, the world's highest (and maybe even scariest) tunnel-to-tunnel bridge -- and yet it...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/04/15/travel/worlds-longest-bridges/index.html

snippet.title: Scientists race to eliminate malaria as 'wonder drug' loses its powers
Scientists race to eliminate malaria as 'wonder drug' loses its powers
snippet.description:
* The meandering Moei river marks the natural boundary between Thailand and Myanmar. Its muddy waters are at their fullest, but Francois Nosten still crosses them in just a minute, aboard a narrow, wooden boat. In the dry season, he could wade across. As he steps onto the western riverbank, in Myanmar, he passes no checkpoint and presents no passport...
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/25/health/scientists-eliminate-malaria/index.html

snippet.title: 22 spots for spectacular starry skies
snippet.description:
* As the new series of "Cosmos" (only available to Fox viewers in the United States) seeks to unveil the wonders of the universe, you might be inspired to seek out these astronomical spectacles for yourself.
http://www.cnn.com/2014/03/12/travel/dark-sky-parks-and-reserves/index.html

snippet.title: TravelGuide Destination
snippet.description:
* For centuries, the mysterious Buddhist kingdom of Tibet piqued the imagination of curious outsiders eager to unravel the secrets behind the closed doors to the Roof of the World. Early explorers, driven by romantic visions of a hidden ShangriLa, ambition, or a sense of mission, overcame countless hardships the alpine clim...
http://www.cnn.com/TRAVEL/DESTINATIONS/9908/tibet/index.html

snippet.title: The raid that saw Mandela jailed for life -- Liliesleaf 50 years on
snippet.description:
* From inside a small thatched roof cottage, Ahmed Kathrada watched with horror as a laundry van approaching the main house of Liliesleaf Farm exploded with teams of police officers. He and other anti-apartheid activists hiding out at the farm attempted to jump out of a back window. But they were surrounded, their hopes das...
http://www.cnn.com/2013/07/11/world/africa/s-africa-liliesleaf-barnett/index.html

snippet.title: 'Human error' causes Brazil stadium roof to collapse
snippet.description:
* Brazil's preparations for a major international soccer tournament have been hit by "human error" and heavy rain, which caused the roof of Salvador's host stadium to partially collapse.
http://www.cnn.com/2013/05/28/sport/football/salvador-stadium-roof-brazil-2014/index.html

snippet.title: Ten years on, brothers' tragedy mirrors story of Afghanistan
snippet.description:
* Ten years ago, as the first bombs began to fall on Afghanistan, I was almost 500 miles away with our live satellite transmission dish on the roof of the Marriott hotel in Islamabad, Pakistan.
http://www.cnn.com/2011/10/07/world/afghanistan-tenth-anniversary-robertson/index.html

snippet.title: Mid-Atlantic storms leave trail of fallen roofs, power lines
snippet.description:
* The living quarters of a fire station in Maryland exploded and burned Thursday after its snow-laden roof collapsed in the wake of the pair of record-setting snowstorms that howled through the mid-Atlantic region in the past week, state police said.
http://www.cnn.com/2010/US/weather/02/11/winter.storm/index.html
